verses.roman:
matsyo gṛhīto matsya-ghnair
jālenānyaiḥ sahārṇave
tasyodara-gataṁ lohaṁ
sa śalye lubdhako 'karot

synonyms: matsyaḥ—the fish; gṛhītaḥ—being seized; matsya-ghnaiḥ—by fishermen; jālena—with a net; anyaiḥ saha—along with other fish; arṇave—within the ocean; tasya—of the fish; udara-gatam—contained in the stomach; loham—lump of iron; saḥ—he (Jarā); śalye—on his arrow; lubdhakaḥ—a hunter; akarot—placed.
translation: The fish was caught in the ocean along with other fish in a fisherman's net. The iron lump in the fish's stomach was taken by the hunter Jarā, who fixed it as an arrowhead at the end of his shaft.
